checkpoints.checkpointText: Over this route you can find over 10 pillboxes as in the image. They are the last type of Malta's fortified coastal defences built by the British rule in WW2 and used to house infantrymen armed with small arms. Note the slits for small arms and machine gun fire. The letter P is first character for discount code
A deep sea bathing summer spot for locals. We will soon take a quick extra deviation with a path on the right alongside the next Pillbox paths for more coastal formations.
Coastal erosion at work, forming a mild cave formation. Avoid edges and going under the small caves/ rocks as this area is subject to heavy coastal erosions
A beautiful sea inlet - one of the many we'll observe along the route. Take a moment to enjoy the view.

Watchtower built in 1659 by Knights of St John Grand Master de Redin, as the 9th of the 13 de Redin towers. Note the single entrance on first floor that would have been accessible by a retractable rope or ladder. The number of stone layers before tower entrance are your next 2 characters for discount code
One of the flagship landmarks of the park. We will now take a detour to an uphill path to the right for more discoveries

Built in baroque style out of local limestone, presumably built to serve the religious needs of farmers who lived in the area, and it is sometimes known as Tas-Subriċint. Doorway is decorated with the coat of arms of Bishop Bartolomé Rull, surmounted by the arms of Grand Master Manuel Pinto da Fonseca. The marked year of completion make up your next 4 characters to discount code
You are in the quaint residential area of Zonqor. Letter Z is your next character for discount code. Small garden on your right if you would like a tranquil rest

A deep sea swimming zone, with numerous salt pans on the shore. Couple of restaurants and snack bars nearby. Look out for a particular colour patterned structure - count the number of layers and the digits are your next 2 characters for discount code
We're about to re-enter the official Inwadar Park area. WCs and small picnic area available before entrance.
BBQ Area on the right should you wish to return for a scenic BBQ. Straight ramp ahead for easier terrain - right one for a bit more rugged return to starting point.

highlights.title: Getting there
highlights.description: Route starts from the main bus station in Xghajra. Bus routes 94 from Valletta and 120 from Pembroke/ Mater Dei have this station as their destination. Plenty of parking spaces available along promenade. Start location coordinates: 35.887845, 14.549888

highlights.title: The route
highlights.description: Takes us across and back the Inwadar National Park along the coast near ix-Xgħajra, Ħaż-Żabbar and Wied il-Għajn, offering a unique blend of history and nature experiences.

highlights.title: Terrain
highlights.description: Mostly off the beaten track terrain with some rocky parts, but relatively easy. Comfortable trainers suffice in dry conditions but also consider trekking shoes for more comfort and safety.

highlights.title: Safety Warning
highlights.description: Some parts of this trek takes to cliff edges and areas subject to coastal erosion. Take caution and avoid going to extreme edges.

highlights.title: Amenities
highlights.description: A restaurant is located near the start/ end locaton with nearby public toilets. The same applies half way through the trek. Also passess by small gardens and picnic table area for some rest/ packed lunch

checkpoints.checkpointText: Also known as ir-Ramla taz-Zejtun, offers a mix of sandy shores and flat, rocky areas. You may also find SeaSport providers - one of the best locations for kayaking to explore the nearby sea caves and cliffs.

Artillery battery built by Knights of St. John in 1714-1716 to defend St. Thomas Bay. Known also as Ducluseaux Battery, possibly after the French knight Ducluseaux de Handessus. Part of it (its redan) has collapsed into the sea due to coastal erosion. Pass by the gate and the battery to follow this path
Natural limestone arch sculpted over centuries by sea winds and erosion. An iconic landmark of the Munxar path
Popular trekking landmark soft with spectacular views of light-colored limestone cliffs. Proceed with caution along the cliff edge.

checkpoints.id: Kappella u Torri ta' San Pawl Nawfragu
checkpoints.checkpointTitle: Kappella u Torri ta' San Pawl Nawfragu
checkpoints.checkpointText: We have now entered the area known as Xrobb l-Ghagin and passing by a tower used for residential purposes with an adjacent chapel dedicated to the Shipwreck of St. Paul built in the 18th century. At the cross roads we will first go to the left to explore more Xrobb l-Ghagin

Area name literally meaning `the squeezing of the dough` for the fragile geological composition. We will first go downhill passing by the Xrobb l-Ghagin Sustainability Centre (Picnic area with WCs) for more views of the Hofra il-Kbira and then come back up here to take a side path onto the cliff side

We will be visiting two wonderful limestone cliffed bays known as il-Hofra il-Kbira (the large hole) and il-Hofra iż-Żgħira (the small hole). Observe the small natural arch in between the two bays. Take the stepped path down to the bay for am amazing sea level and cliff side views to it.
We have walked along a small promontory known as Ras il-Fenek where we can get spectacular views of both the Hofriet Bays on either side of it.

A polygonal fort built by the British between 1879 and 1883. Its primary function was as a fire control point controlling the massed guns of Fort Delimara on the headland below. Since 1991, the fort has been rented to the Island Sanctuary as a refuge for dogs. Nice grassed areas around the Fort's ditch which makes an ideal picnic spot

Built between 1881 and 1886 by the British to help Fort Tas-Silġ cover the defence of St Thomas Bay. You can take a small semi-circular walk around the D-shaped battery with three gun emplacements. Can also can serve as a great picnic spot!
A popular recreational area with a small sandy beach highly frequented by locals to swim and relax during the hot summer months, especially for young children.

We could only end the trek with more amazing views of white cliffed seas overlooking St. Thomas Bay. There is a stepped way down to get to sea-level and to a deep sea swimming spot which you may want to keep in mind for next summer

highlights.title: Getting there
highlights.description: Route starts from near St. Thomas Bay Marsascala. Bus Route 91 from Valletta stops near the bay (92 and 93 to other Marsascala locations) or look to park yout vehicle along the St. Thomas Bay promenade. Starting coordinates: 35.855626, 14.566833

highlights.title: White Cliffs and Spectacular Bays
highlights.description: Starting from St. Thomas Bay the route first takes the renowned Munxar path over the white limtestone cliffs and then heads to Marsaxlokk Xrobb l-Ghagin and tas-Silg areas for two of the most spectacular bays in the Maltese Islands - il-Hofra il-Kbira and il-Hofra iż-Żgħira.

highlights.title: Terrain
highlights.description: Large parts on off the beaten track for which trekking shoes are highly recommended for comfort and safety.

highlights.title: Safety Warning
highlights.description: Parts of this trek are along cliff edges. Keep focus and caution

highlights.title: Amenities
highlights.description: WCs near start and end points and half way through during the opening hours of the Xrobb l-Ghagin Sustainability Centre. Plenty of restaurants and snack bars at the starting and ending destinations. Various seasport providers at St. Thomas Bay.

checkpoints.checkpointText: Description....
Glimpse of World War 2 Pillbox fortification used to host infantry men with machine gun fire.
Has Saptan is characterised by a series of freshwater rockpools within Lower Coralline Limestone hosting rare species like the Tadpole Shrimp and the Painted Frog.
Info on the house
Hope you enjoyed this walk overlooking Wied Zembaq over its East side. Now we will be taking a path on your left side - look for rocks forming natural steps to a perpendicular path higher up.

Historical info on the wall. There are also Perhistoric temple remains cared after by Heritage Malta. After the trek you may wish to by a combo ticket to vist this site togeteher with Ghar Dalam Cave (500,000 year old pre-historic cave) and Museum. Tickets from Heritage Malta site or Ghar Dalam Museum.
A peacuful haven for tranquility and Catholic prayer dedicated to St. Mary
A small sandy beach with views towards Marsaxlokk. Enjoy the final stroll along the promenade and traditional Maltese boards ending our trek at Pretty Bay

Battery constructed in 1716 by the Order of St John and tasked with defending Pretty bay. Whilst now in poor condition, traces of the semi-circular gun platform have survived. The parapet, redan and ditch have been destroyed altogether.

highlights.title: Getting there
highlights.description: Route starts from the San Pietru fil-Ktajjen Birzeubbuga Parish church and ends at nearby Pretty Bay. From Valletta you can tae bus routes 80 or 82. Starting coordinates: 35.827314, 14.527435

highlights.title: The route
highlights.description: Will take us over and into a number of valleys - Valleys Zembaq, Saptan and Dalam, with the highlight being reaching id-Dar ta Pultu nestled within the valleys.

highlights.title: Terrain
highlights.description: Relatively easy terrain with a mix of asphalted road and off the beaten track. Trekking shoes recommended, and necessary if terrain may not be dry

highlights.title: Amenities
highlights.description: Public toilets present at Pretty Bay which is the end destination (close to starting location). Plenty of restaurants and snack bars available near start and end locations too!

checkpoints.checkpointText: Info on the fortified wall
Farms & Farmhouses
Info on the Fort
On your right - largest solar farm in Malta. Small Island of Filfla ... protected nature reserve... we'll walk closer to it and other treks with a closer view
Look for and follow this path for a hidden gem discovery. Goes alongside cliff edges. Stay safe and do only what you're comfortable with!
Hidden Gem! You probably get why this cave gets it's name. Venture inside only if you feel you can do so safely
Find the path from the road to the cliffside path
Legend has it that ... Currently closed for safety reasons but can take a sneak peak
We'll next hike to Znuber valley. There are rock-hewn stairs leading to it. Follow them and stay safe!
Enoy the cliff-sided valley view onto the sea and the iconic stair path
Info on the Chapel
Recently opened park where you can enjoy and gather info on various tree species. Many picnic tables where you can take a snack and some rest before the final stretch back to Pretty Bay

highlights.title: Getting there
highlights.description: Bus routes and parking information. Coordinates to start point.

highlights.title: Cliffs, Caves & Znuber Valley
highlights.description: Benghisa countryside - Then... Details on the type of excursion.

highlights.title: Safety Warning
highlights.description: Cliffside Paths & entering caves. Do only what you are comfortable and safe doing.

highlights.title: Terrain
highlights.description: Terrain - Shoes. Weather conditions.

highlights.title: Amenities
highlights.description: WCs, picnic areas, restaurants and other facilities

checkpoints.checkpointText: Seaviews
Fort and Park
Dedicated to San Gakbu...
Looking over to Smart City

highlights.title: Test Route
highlights.description: To check if it works

treks.name: Tempji-Lapsi Trail
treks.shortDescription: Archeological Park with Prehistoric Temples to Pristine Bays

checkpoints.checkpointText: Buy tickets during from here to view artefacts and visit the Hagar Qim and Mnajdra Archeological Archeological Park. Buy tickets from here or a snack
Hagar Qim info - The first of the two... dated...
The second set of temples...
Monument dedicated to Sir Walter Congreve, a former Governor of Malta who upon his wish was buried at sea between this Monument and the island of Filfla

One of the 13 coastal towers built by the Knights of St John Grand Master de Redin. Built in 1658-1659 as part of a chain of coastal fortifications to protect agaist the threat of a Turkish invasion and corsairs

Now we head back to Congreve Memorial over the Garrigue landscape. Look for a steep path down on the left side of the memorial. Path is very steep so do only in safe conditions - get down on your bottocks if required for further safety!
Natural arch ....
The coastal stretch we will be following (higher up) is formed by several of such pretty small bays
Proceed with caution to discover this hidden small inlet sea formation
One of the most iconic bays in the Maltese Islands. Admire the cave formation enclosing the bay. Restaurant, restrooms and WC facilities
Lapsi Tower... You can get closer taking a side path
Info on the water carriage
Take a look at the sea valley formation whilst respecting private property
Only stretch of trek alongside road traffic... but wide street and named Panarama Road for a reason!

Look for this path on your right for a more scenic off the beaten trek to the Megalithic temples. You'll be walking in a Garigue (Xaghri) landscape characteristic of many parts of the island, consisting of exposed open spaces with rugged, rocky outcrops and dry shrubs which spring into life in Autumn. The most common hosted species is the Mediterranean Thyme whose perfume attracts many species, including the Maltese bee.
As we reach the temples and end of trek, take some time again to admire the view. Hope you enjoyed the trek!

highlights.title: Getting there
highlights.description: Bus routes and parking information. Coordinates to start point.

highlights.title: Archeological Park and then heading to hidden gems and landmarks along the Coast
highlights.description: Details on the type of excursion.

highlights.title: Another trek combining history and nature
highlights.description: The trail passes near ancient watchtowers and fortifications.

highlights.title: Terrain
highlights.description: Terrain - Shoes. Weather conditions.

highlights.title: Safety Warnings
highlights.description: Terrain - Shoes. Weather conditions.

highlights.title: Amenities
highlights.description: WCs, picnic areas, restaurants and other facilities

checkpoints.checkpointText: First glimples of the Wied Ghomor greener as we walk under a flyover road.
Take the road on the left for a path into the valley

You have reached the heart of the vallery and its greener vegetation. Enjoy the peaceful surroundings. You can venture further if feeling adventorous and conditions allow but this routes goes back along the same path we came from.
From the short flight of steps enjoy an elevated view of the Mensija Valley we'll be heading to next
Again surronded by vegetation, we are in the heart of the second valley of the trek - Wied Mensija.

A suggestive picnic area with views over the valley. A good spot for a snack break before we head back to the coast. We will next walk for a short while on a busy road. Take care, especially crossing the road
Ghomor Valley on one Side and Spinola Bay on the other, with the St. Julian's Parish church right in front. One of the more modern churches built in 1961 and visited by the Pope in 1989.
One of the most picturesque and iconic bays in Malta, with vibrant colours from the colourful luzzus and lively atmosphere. Picturesque in different ways during both the day and night

The small sandy beach overlooked by splendid Neo-Gothic facade of the Church of Our Lady of Mount Carmel, make this another iconic hotspot in the Maltese islands. The interior Gothic architecture of the church is equally impressive. This promenade stretch offers a magnificient relaxing spot to end the trek.

highlights.title: Getting there
highlights.description: The route starts from the well known Spinola Bay, near the `LOVE` monument. Bus routes 13, 14 and 16 run from Valletta and Sliema to the bay. Routes 202, 212 and 222 arrive from Northern regions. Finding parking can be challenging - the Ta' Giorni area in nearby San Gwann is a quieter option and not too distant. Route ends in nearby Balluta Bay. GPS coordinates to starting point: 35.9191, 14.4900.

highlights.title: The Route
highlights.description: A scenic walk starting from coast and heading into the green lung of the area - Wied Ghomor and Mensija. Returns to the coastal promenade, ending at the picturesque Balluta bay.

highlights.title: Terrain
highlights.description: For the major part on asphalted roads, venturing into some valley paths. Can be done in trainers in dry conditions. Little elevation change.

highlights.title: Safety Warning
highlights.description: A small part of the route is along busy roads and contains a couple of busy road crossings. Take caution and use zebra crossing/ lights where possible

highlights.title: Amenities
highlights.description: The starting and ending locations are at very touristic areas with a wide variety of tourist amenities. Half way through, the route passes by a quiet picnic area with tables - so bringing a packed lunch is also a good idea!

checkpoints.checkpointText: Area known as tax-Xlejli in Gudja. Restroom facilties
Now moving to countryside roads. Although quite quiet, the streets are narrow so keep on the left side
In the distance over the fields you can spot the Ta Loretu chapel. Another landmark you can reach from the centre of Gudja on another trek
Enjoy an iconic view of this trek overlooking the Saptan Valley
One of the three semaphore towers in Malta. We are now in the village of Hal Ghaxaq

checkpoints.checkpointTitle: Tiny Park dedicated to Animal love
checkpoints.checkpointText: A small haven where you can take a break near the monument dedicated to animals and let the little ones name the animals
Enjoy more views over the agricultural fields

The Xlejli Tower also known as Bettina Tower now comes into view. It is thought to have served as a watchtower as far as from Roman or Medieval times but its exact age remains a mystery. It is located within a private Palazzo but you can get closer from the paths on your right

Roman Catholic church dedicated to the Assumption of St. Mary whose feast is celebrated on the 15th of August. Built mostly in Baroque style and built in 1656 on the plans of Tumas Dingli. The trek now closes at Gnien Raymond Caruana for a well deserved rest or kids play time.

highlights.title: Getting there
highlights.description: Route starts from the parish church of Gudja and ends at a nearby garden. Bus 88 from Valletta goes to start location. Most parking slots in tax-Xlejli area if by private transport. Start location coordinates: 35.8481865, 14.5027438

highlights.title: Type of Walk
highlights.description: Most of walk goes along countryside roads in Gudja and Ghaxaq to enjoy most of the nature views in this area.

highlights.title: Terrain
highlights.description: Very flat route, most of it on tarmac roads with parts on a bit bumpier concrete paths.

highlights.title: Safety Warning
highlights.description: While light on traffic, vehicles can approach on some of the narrow countryside roads. Keep caution by sticking to left side of the road.

highlights.title: Amenities
highlights.description: Route takes to a public garden with restroom facilities a few minutes after the start, and ends in another public garden. Restaurant with Maltese cuisine near Parish church.
